Segments.Text: We report a pedigree of Branchio-oto-renal dysplasia (BOR syndrome), including documentation through serial audiometric studies of the onset and rapid progression of hearing loss in the twin sister of an affected child.

Source.Text: Se informa un pedigrí de displasia branquio-oto-renal (el síndrome BOR), incluida la documentación mediante estudios audiométricos seriados del inicio y la rápida progresión de la pérdida auditiva en la hermana gemela de un niño afectado.

Segments.Text: The literature on this syndrome is analyzed to derive some figures for its use in the genetic counseling of these families.

Source.Text: Se analiza la literatura sobre este síndrome para derivar algunas cifras para su uso en el asesoramiento genético de dichas familias.

Annotations.Text: is analyzed to derive some figures for its use in the genetic counseling of these

Segments.Text: Branchio-Oto-renal dysplasia is an autosomal dominant disorder in which affected individuals may present with preauricular Fossae, lacrimal duct stenosis, hearing loss, branchial fistulas or cysts, structural defects of the external, middle and inner ear and renal anomalies, which may range from mild hypoplasia to total absence.

Source.Text: La displasia branquio-oto-renal es un trastorno autosómico dominante en el que los individuos afectados pueden presentar fosas preauriculares, estenosis del conducto lagrimal, hipoacusia, fístulas branquiales o quistes, defectos estructurales del oído externo, medio e interno y anomalías renales, que pueden van desde hipoplasia leve hasta ausencia total.

Annotations.Text: in which affected individuals may present with

Segments.Text: Not all the characteristics of the syndrome are expressed in all the carriers of the gene, but few carriers lack all the characteristics, and the fossa, the branchial clefts and the hearing loss are often expressed.

Source.Text: No todas las características del síndrome se expresan en todos los portadores del gen, pero pocos portadores carecen de todas las características, y las fosas, las hendiduras branquiales y la hipoacusia se expresan con frecuencia.

Segments.Text: Not all the characteristics of the syndrome are expressed in all the carriers of the gene, but few carriers lack all the characteristics, and the fossa, the branchial clefts and the hearing loss are often expressed.

clefts and the hearing loss are often expressed.
